meanings.definition: The intestines or guts, especially regarded as the seat of deep emotions or feelings.
meanings.sent1: When she heard the sad news, she felt it in her kishkes.
meanings.sent2: He trusted his kishkes to guide him in making important decisions.
meanings.sent3: His kishkes were in a knot when he had to give a speech in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent4: She had a gut feeling in her kishkes that something was about to go wrong.
meanings.sent5: The movie touched her kishkes, leaving her in tears.

meanings.definition: The innermost parts or essence of something.
meanings.sent1: The kishkes of the issue revealed a complex web of interconnected problems.
meanings.sent2: To truly understand the story, you need to delve into the kishkes of its characters.
meanings.sent3: The kishkes of the mystery were slowly unraveled by the detective.
meanings.sent4: His music reached the kishkes of the listeners, stirring deep emotions.
meanings.sent5: The artist poured her kishkes into every brushstroke, creating a masterpiece.
